item.title: Former Tesla president discloses the secret to scaling a company
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: “We scaled Tesla in 30 months from $2 billion in revenue to $20 billion in revenue,” said Jon McNeil, who is now co-founder and CEO of DVx Ventures.

item.title: Why Cartken pivoted its focus from last-mile delivery to industrial robots
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Cartken started seeing an influx of demand for its last-mile delivery robots from industrial customers and is now focused on that sector.

item.title: Tesla loses its charm for India’s loyalists — even as Musk finally delivers
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Tesla's debut in India has not convinced its early backers, who waited for the company to enter the market for nearly a decade.

item.title: Microsoft says it will no longer use engineers in China for Department of Defense work
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Following a Pro Publica report that Microsoft was using engineers in China to help maintain cloud computing systems for the U.S. Department of Defense, the company said it’s made changes to ensure this will no longer happen.

item.title: Astronomer CEO resigns following Coldplay concert scandal
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Andy Byron, the startup executive at the center of an extraordinary social media furor, has resigned as CEO of data operations startup Astronomer.

item.title: David Sacks and the blurred lines of government service
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: When Vultron, a startup that creates AI tools specifically for federal contractors, announced its $22 million funding round earlier this week, it made sure to highlight a key investor: Craft Ventures, the firm “co-founded by White House AI adviser David Sacks.” The announcement has raised questions about conflicts of interest in the Trump administration, where […]

item.title: Windsurf CEO opens up about ‘very bleak’ mood before Cognition deal
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Days after AI coding startup Windsurf announced that it’s being acquired by Cognition, Windsurf exec Jeff Wang took to X to offer more details about the drama and uncertainty around the deal.

item.title: The perfect pitch: This NEA partner says every founder should answer these 5 questions
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Tiffany Luck, a partner at NEA, outlined what she looks for in a pitch, during a presentation at TechCrunch’s All Stage event in Boston.

item.title: These are our favorite cyber books on hacking, espionage, crypto, surveillance, and more
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai, Zack Whittaker
item.description: These are our favorite cybersecurity books, both by fiction authors, as well as journalists and researchers.

item.title: For privacy and security, think twice before granting AI access to your personal data
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: AI chatbots, assistants and agents are increasingly asking for gross levels of access to your personal data under the guise of needing your information to make them work.

item.title: Benchmark in talks to lead Series A for Greptile, valuing AI-code reviewer at $180M, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: YC alum Greptile raises $30M Series A.

item.title: Why a Y Combinator startup tackling AI agents for Windows gave up and pivoted
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Pig.dev was working on a problem that could have been revolutionary: agent tech for controlling Windows desktops.

item.title: ServiceNow’s acquisition of Moveworks is reportedly being reviewed over antitrust concerns
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The probe into the acquisition, which was announced in March, began in June according to sources familiar with the matter.

item.title: Cursor snaps up enterprise startup Koala in challenge to GitHub Copilot
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Cursor maker Anysphere is snapping up top talent from AI enterprise startups in an effort to compete with Microsoft's GitHub Copilot.

item.title: What is Mistral AI? Everything to know about the OpenAI competitor
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Mistral AI, the French company behind AI assistant Le Chat and several foundational models, is officially regarded as one of France’s most promising tech startups and is arguably the only European company that could compete with OpenAI. But compared to its $6 billion valuation, its global market share is still relatively low.  However, the recent […]

item.title: A surveillance vendor was caught exploiting a new SS7 attack to track people’s phone locations
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The new SS7 bypass attack tricks phone operators into disclosing a cell subscriber's location, in some cases down to a few hundred meters.

item.title: CaaStle founder charged with fraud, turns herself in
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The US Attorney for the Southern District of New York unsealed an indictment against Christine Hunsicker, charging her with wire fraud, securities fraud, money laundering, aggravated identity theft, and lying to financial institutions.

item.title: SpaceX worker injury rates at Starbase outpace industry rivals
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: SpaceX has been moving at a breakneck pace, and rapid progress comes at a cost. Worker injury rates at its Starbase facility are almost 6x higher than the average, data reveals.

item.title: DuckDuckGo now lets you hide AI-generated images in search results
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: DuckDuckGo's new search feature comes as the internet is being flooded with AI-generated slop.

item.title: With her app Smash, Kesha can be whoever she wants — even a tech CEO
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Kesha is building an app called Smash, which is a way for musicians to find one another, make music together, and establish clear, artist-friendly contracts among collaborators.
